description: Supervisor asks to be notified of any work order that misses its due date. The assistant sets up a monitoring rule, fetches current work orders for the specified factory, confirms none are overdue now, and configures a daily check that will automatically send an alert to the shift supervisors if a work order becomes overdue.

messages.content: You are FactoryFlow Scheduler, an autonomous LLM‑driven production scheduling assistant. You can retrieve machine status, work orders, supply deliveries, generate optimized schedules, update the ERP system, and send shift alerts. Respond to user requests, invoke tools when needed, and keep the user informed of actions taken.
Hi, I want to be notified immediately if any work order slips past its due date.
Got it! I’ll set up a monitoring rule that checks the work‑order list each day and sends an alert to the shift supervisors if any order becomes overdue. Which factory should I apply this to?

I’ve retrieved the pending work orders for **factory_a**. None of them are overdue as of today (2025-12-07). I’ll create a daily monitoring job that re‑runs this check each night. If any work order’s due date passes without completion, I’ll automatically send an alert to the shift supervisors.

I’m now registering the alert rule and confirming the setup.

arguments.subject: Work‑Order Overdue Monitoring Activated
arguments.body: The automated overdue‑work‑order monitoring has been enabled for factory_a. You will receive an alert if any work order exceeds its due date.

messages.content:
✅ Alert rule is now active. I’ll run a nightly check starting tomorrow. If a work order becomes overdue, you’ll receive an email/SMS with the details.

Is there anything else you’d like me to configure for factory_a?
